summary: This is an internal email dated August 14, 2019, listing 11 staff members on AWOL (Absent Without Leave) status for the week of August 4-10, 2019, primarily due to issues with OWCP (Office of Workers' Compensation Programs) cases ending, lack of LWOP (Leave Without Pay) approval, or medical reasons. It also mentions an attached augmentation agreement but no agreement on overtime sign-up procedures. The document appears to be routine administrative HR correspondence and does not directly reference Epstein, his associates, victims, or criminal activities.

events.title: AWOL Status Week Begins
events.description: The week during which 11 staff members were reported as being on AWOL (Absent Without Leave) status.

events.title: AWOL Status Week Ends
events.description: The end of the week during which 11 staff members were reported as being on AWOL status.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email dated August 14, 2019, concerning staff administrative status.
It lists 11 staff members as AWOL (Absent Without Leave) for the week of August 4-10, 2019, totaling 40 hours each.
The primary reasons for AWOL status are related to OWCP (workers' compensation) cases ending without the employee returning, lack of approved LWOP (Leave Without Pay), or medical issues/surgery.
One specific case mentions a probationary officer injured in a motorcycle accident who has recent LWOP approval.
The email notes an attached 'augmentation agreement' but states there is no agreement concerning overtime sign-up procedures.
